intro: Apactis, commonly known as the fairy daisies, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to Australia and are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Apactis species typically have hairy stems and leaves, and their flowers are often pink, purple, or white. They are commonly found in a variety of habitats, including grasslands, woodlands, and coastal areas. Many species within this genus are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their delicate appearance and long-lasting blooms.
